articles.headline: Two Men Charged in Pelvic Mesh Removal Scheme
articles.snippet: An indictment in Brooklyn says a physician and a medical consultant were part of a network that enticed women to have surgery to bolster lawsuit settlements.
articles.abstract: An indictment in Brooklyn says a physician and a medical consultant were part of a network that enticed women to have surgery to bolster lawsuit settlements.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn have charged a physician and the owner of a medical consulting firm over a scheme to persuade women to have their pelvic mesh implants surgically removed to bolster the value of lawsuits against the devices’ manufacturers.

articles.headline: Theresa May’s Resignation Throws a Fractured Britain Into Further Turmoil
articles.snippet: The prime minister’s departure throws Britain into an unpredictable quandary after three years of trying and failing to pull the country out of the European Union.
articles.abstract: The prime minister’s departure throws Britain into an unpredictable quandary after three years of trying and failing to pull the country out of the European Union.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Theresa May announced her resignation on Friday after three years of trying and failing to pull Britain out of the European Union, throwing her country into an unpredictable situation and setting off a bare-knuckled contest among other Conservative lawmakers to replace her.
articles.byline: By Benjamin Mueller and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: In Parliament Elections, Populists Seek to Break the E.U. From Within
articles.snippet: Not long ago, nationalist movements pushed for a departure from the European Union. Now they are seeking seats in Parliament, promising an insurgency from within.
articles.abstract: Not long ago, nationalist movements pushed for a departure from the European Union. Now they are seeking seats in Parliament, promising an insurgency from within.
articles.lead_paragraph: REGGELLO, Italy — The stage was set for war. Literally. Inside a small Tuscan theater with a mock-up of a World War I trench, Susanna Ceccardi, a rising star of Italy’s hard-right League party, was flanked by rival candidates for the European Parliament elections and firing angry salvos against a club she soon hopes to join.

articles.headline: Huawei Ban Threatens Wireless Service in Rural Areas
articles.snippet: Many small carriers depend on inexpensive equipment from the Chinese company. Now they must rethink expansion plans, and perhaps replace existing gear.
articles.abstract: Many small carriers depend on inexpensive equipment from the Chinese company. Now they must rethink expansion plans, and perhaps replace existing gear.
articles.lead_paragraph: OPHEIM, Mont. — Kevin Nelson was recently in the middle of his 3,800-acre farm in northeast Montana, where the landscape stretches out like an ocean, when his tractor broke. He tried to find a cellular signal strong enough to send a photo of the broken part to a repair shop 65 miles away, but failed.

articles.headline: In Baltimore and Beyond, a Stolen N.S.A. Tool Wreaks Havoc
articles.snippet: American cities are being hijacked with an N.S.A. cyberweapon that has already done billions of dollars in damage overseas. The N.S.A. will say nothing.
articles.abstract: American cities are being hijacked with an N.S.A. cyberweapon that has already done billions of dollars in damage overseas. The N.S.A. will say nothing.
articles.lead_paragraph: For nearly three weeks, Baltimore has struggled with a cyberattack by digital extortionists that has frozen thousands of computers, shut down email and disrupted real estate sales, water bills, health alerts and many other services.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and Scott Shane

articles.headline: A Lesson of Sandy Hook: ‘Err on the Side of the Victims’
articles.snippet: A tidal wave of aid bore witness to the power of human kindness, but the money that engulfed Newtown, Conn., also sowed division.
articles.abstract: A tidal wave of aid bore witness to the power of human kindness, but the money that engulfed Newtown, Conn., also sowed division.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWTOWN, Conn. — Scarlett Lewis sees reminders of her son Jesse — who died at age 6 with 19 classmates and six educators in the 2012 Sandy Hook school shooting — in photographs on her refrigerator door, in portraits she painted of him from memory and now, uncomfortably, in the Newtown Community Center, a soaring new complex.

articles.headline: 1,600 Miles, 85 Hours: A Migrant Family Takes a Greyhound Across America
articles.snippet: Entering the U.S. at a rate of more than 5,000 a day, new arrivals from Central America are departing border towns by the busload. And that bus is usually a Greyhound.
articles.abstract: Entering the U.S. at a rate of more than 5,000 a day, new arrivals from Central America are departing border towns by the busload. And that bus is usually a Greyhound.
articles.lead_paragraph: Entering the U.S. at a rate of more than 5,000 a day, new arrivals from Central America are departing border towns by the busload. And that bus is usually a Greyhound.

articles.headline: Fiat Chrysler Set to Propose a Merger With Renault
articles.snippet: The two companies were deep in talks over the weekend about the structure of a deal and how to handle the political implications.
articles.abstract: The two companies were deep in talks over the weekend about the structure of a deal and how to handle the political implications.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fiat Chrysler is planning to propose a merger with the French carmaker Renault on Monday, according to two people involved in the negotiations, in a transaction that could reshape the global automobile industry.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette, Andrew Ross Sorkin and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Craft Brewers Lighten Up and Take Aim at the ‘Sweaty Consumer’
articles.snippet: Smaller breweries are responding to the demands of consumers more concerned with health and active lifestyles than they are with hops or high alcohol content.
articles.abstract: Smaller breweries are responding to the demands of consumers more concerned with health and active lifestyles than they are with hops or high alcohol content.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Sam Calagione, a founder of the craft brewery Dogfish Head, his company’s efforts to get healthier had a selfish origin.

articles.headline: ‘It Was Like a Zoo’: Death on an Unruly, Overcrowded Everest
articles.snippet: This has been one of the deadliest climbing seasons on the world’s highest peak. Veteran climbers blame increased permits for climbers, including many who are inexperienced.
articles.abstract: This has been one of the deadliest climbing seasons on the world’s highest peak. Veteran climbers blame increased permits for climbers, including many who are inexperienced.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Ed Dohring, a doctor from Arizona, had dreamed his whole life of reaching the top of Mount Everest. But when he summited a few days ago, he was shocked by what he saw.
articles.byline: By Kai Schultz, Jeffrey Gettleman, Mujib Mashal and Bhadra Sharma

articles.headline: ‘Ship of Horror’: Discovery of the Last Slave Ship to America Brings New Hope to an Old Community
articles.snippet: Enslaved Africans smuggled into Alabama in the schooner Clotilda founded Africatown after the Civil War. Now residents want to raise the wreck from under the Mobile River as a symbol of pride.
articles.abstract: Enslaved Africans smuggled into Alabama in the schooner Clotilda founded Africatown after the Civil War. Now residents want to raise the wreck from under the Mobile River as a symbol of pride.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOBILE, Ala. — Like nearly everyone who grew up in Africatown, Felice Harris had heard the origin story of her little Alabama neighborhood, passed around from relative to relative and house to house.

articles.headline: European Election Results Show Growing Split Over Union’s Future
articles.snippet: As both pro-E.U. and anti-E.U. forces seemed likely to claim some victories, the vote made clear that arguing over the future of the bloc would intensify.
articles.abstract: As both pro-E.U. and anti-E.U. forces seemed likely to claim some victories, the vote made clear that arguing over the future of the bloc would intensify.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Populists and nationalists who want to chip away at the European Union’s powers increased their share in Europe’s Parliament after four days of continent-wide elections, but it was not the deluge that many traditionalists had feared.

articles.headline: Renault Considering Fiat’s Offer to Merge Into a New Auto Giant
articles.snippet: The combined company would be the No. 3 automaker and have a better chance of surviving a perilous transition to electric and self-driving cars.
articles.abstract: The combined company would be the No. 3 automaker and have a better chance of surviving a perilous transition to electric and self-driving cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: The French carmaker Renault said on Monday that it was considering a proposal by Fiat Chrysler to merge and form a global partnership aimed at improving their chances of surviving the coming perilous and costly shift to electric and self-driving cars.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing, Liz Alderman, Andrew Ross Sorkin and Neal E. Boudette

articles.headline: With the 2020 Democratic Field Set, Candidates Begin the Races Within the Race
articles.snippet: The competitive lanes are set as candidates vie for black voters, women, younger voters — but they are fluid. One thing seems sure: Joseph R. Biden’s lead will be tested.
articles.abstract: The competitive lanes are set as candidates vie for black voters, women, younger voters — but they are fluid. One thing seems sure: Joseph R. Biden’s lead will be tested.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWTON, Iowa — Joseph R. Biden Jr. has built an early lead in the month since he entered the presidential campaign, confidently projecting himself as the Democratic front-runner and the candidate best positioned to defeat President Trump.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Reid J. Epstein

articles.headline: With His Job Gone, an Autoworker Wonders, ‘What Am I as a Man?’
articles.snippet: Rick Marsh worked in the car plant in Lordstown his entire life. Now that job is gone. What does that mean for his politics?
articles.abstract: Rick Marsh worked in the car plant in Lordstown his entire life. Now that job is gone. What does that mean for his politics?
articles.lead_paragraph: LORDSTOWN, Ohio — In the weeks since he lost his job at the car plant, Rick Marsh has blasted Pink Floyd while cleaning the house. He has watched the cat watching the birds. He has smoked cigarettes out the sliding glass door. He has watched Motor Trend, a TV network about cars. He bought a grill and built a swing set.

articles.headline: Brexit Is Sending Students Packing, Straining Private Schools on Both Ends
articles.snippet: While campuses in Britain look toward Asia in their struggle to refill seats, those on the Continent are scrambling to prepare for a crush of new pupils.
articles.abstract: While campuses in Britain look toward Asia in their struggle to refill seats, those on the Continent are scrambling to prepare for a crush of new pupils.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For years Dover College, on the southeast coast of England, has attracted a steady flow of summer students from across the channel, with parents willing to pay for their children to learn English in a boarding school environment.
